(!?) Black sacrifices a pawn in an attempt to complete development as quickly as possible.
Obviously, 6...Nxd5?? Lost since 7.Qxd5 Qxd5 8.Nc7... One recommended variation is 7.N1c3!?... And White should start thinking about development.
Obviously, 6...Nxd5?? Lost since 7.Qxd5 Qxd5 8.Nc7... One recommended variation is 7.N1c3!?... And White should start thinking about development.
(?) The single-mindedness of material gain leads to the strong attack performed by Black.
(!) A further sacrifice. 7...Ne4? Would give White the advantage after 8.e3 Nxd6 9.Qd5!...

(?) White's tunnel vision of material gain is the wrong game plan! Nonetheless, it's important to mention that other better variations aren't satisfactory to improvement for White : 8.e3 Nc6 9.Be2 a6 with material equality and an advantage for Black. Also, 8.Be3 Bxe3 9.fxe3 Na6 10.N1c3 Bd7 11.Qd2 Bxb5 12.Nxb5 Ne4 13.Qd5 Qa5+ 14.Nc3 Nac5 with some dangerous threats from Black. ( If you like this game, look at this one - Svedchikov - Ceytlin [USSR 1977])
(!) The initiative is clearly with Black. The checkmate threat on f2 provides this.
9.Be3... Wouldn't help since 9...Bxe3 10.fxe3 Qf6! And an excellent game for Black. This is shown since 11.Qc2 Qf2+ 12.Kd1 Qxe3 OR 11.Qb3 Qf2+ 12.Kd1 Rd8 OR 11.Qd3 Nf2!

No other defence exists! Other options : 10.Nc3 Nxc3 11.bxc3 Bxc3+ 12.Bd2 Bxa1 13.Qxa1 Qxd6 14.Nxa8 Nc6 - Black regains the knight after ...Bf5 and has both positional and material advantage! : 10.Nd2 Qxd6 11.Nxa8 Rd8 -/+ : 10.Bd2 Nxd2 11.Nxd2 Qxd6 12.Nxa8 Rd8 -/+ The attack gains full flow in the last two examples.
